_prev_prog_2.Description: DAILY ASSESS THE OPERATION & EQUIPMENT OF THE FACILITY TO BE SURE ALL SAFETY PRECAUSIONS ARE BEING FOLLOWED

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
POLICY STATEMENT

THE FOLLOWING WRITEN HAZARD COMMUNICATION PROGRAM HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED FOR THE  CENTRAL ERIE SUPPLY & ELEVATOR ASS'N. IT IS THE POLICY OF CENTRAL ERIE TO ACTIVELY PROVIDE FOR THE WELL BEING OF THE EMPLOYEES BY WILLINGLY ADHERING TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE HAZARD COMMUNICATION STANDARD 1910.1200 AND OTHER APPLICABLE CITY, STATE AND FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS.

1.   HAZARD DETERMINATION

CENTRAL ERIE SUPPLY & ELEVATOR ASS'N WILL RELAY ON THE CHEMICAL MANUFACTURER'S MATERIAL SAFTY       
DATA SHEETS (MSDS) FOR THE HAZARD DETERMINATION.

2.   CONTAINER LABELING

CHEMICAL MANUFACTURER'S LABELING SYSTEM WILL BE USED AT CENTRAL EIRE SUPPLY & ELEVATOR ASS'N.
THE DOCK UNLOADING SUPERVISOR WILL VERIFY THAT CONTAINERS RECEIVED WILL:
BE CLEARLY LABLED AS TO THE CONTENTS
NOTE THE APPROPRIATE HAZARD WARNING(S)
STATE TARGET ORGAN(S)
LIST THE NAME AND ADDRESS OF THE MANUFACTURER
IT IS THE POLICY OF THE COMPANY THAT NO CONTAINER WILL BE RELEASED FOR USE UNTIL THE ABOVE 
DATA IS VERIFIED.
THE SUPERVISOR IN EACH DEPARTMENT WILL ENSURE THAT ALL SECONDARY CONTAINERS ARE PROPERLY LABLED AND THAT ALL LABELS ARE LEGIBLE.

3.   MATERIAL SAFTY DATA SHEETS (MSDS)

COPIES OF MSDSs FOR ALL HAZARDOUS CHEMICALS TO WHICH EMPLOYEES OF THIS COMPANY MAY BE EXPOSED ARE KEPT IN THE FOLLOWING LOCATIONS: AT COUNTER IN THE MAIN OFFICE

IT WILL BE THE RESONSIBILITY OF THE OFFICE MANAGER TO MAINTAIN, UPDATE AND DISTRIBUTE MSDSs

NO NEW PRODUCT OF A HAZARDOUS NATURE WILL BE ACCEPTED IN THE WORKPLACE WITHOUT AN MSDS ON FILE OR ACCOMPANYING THE SHIPMENT

MANUFACTURES OF DISTRIBUTORS FAILINGTO PROVIDE MSDS's WILL BE CONSIDERED AS FAILING TO MEET CONTRACTUAL REQUIREMENTS. THIS STATEMENT SHALL APPEAR ON PURCHASE ORDER OR OFFERS TO BID. THE PURCHASING DEPARTMENT SHALL MONITOR THIS.

MSDS's ARE REQUIRED PRIOR TO ANY HAZARDOUS MATERIAL(S) BEING INTODUCED INTO OUR FACILITY BY CONTRACTORS, VENDORS, SALES-PEOPLE, FREQUENTERS OF OUR EMPLOYEES.

4.   EMPLOYEE TRAINING AND INFORMATION

THE MANAGER IS RESPONSI

BLE FOR INIITIAL TRAINING OF EMPLOYEES. SUPERVISORS WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR SPECIFIC ONSITE TRAINING AND FOLLOW UP.

PRIOR TO STARTING WORK EACH NEW EMPLOYEE WILL ATTEND A SAFETY AND HEALTH ORIENTATION AND WIL RECEIVE INFORMATION AND TRAINING ON THE FOLLOWING:
AN OVERVIEW OF THE REQUIREMENTS CONTAINED IN THE HAZARD COMMUNICATION PROGRAM.

CHEMICALS PRESENTS IN THEIR WORKPLACE OPERATIONS.

LOCATION AND AVAILABILITY OF OUR WRITTEN HAZCOM PROGRAM.

PHYSICAL AND HEALTH EFFECTS OF THE HAZARDOUS CHEMICALS.

METHODS AND OBSERVATION TECHNIQUES USED TO DETERMANE THE PRESENCE OR RELEASE OF HAZARDOUS CHEMICALS IN THE WORK AREA.

HOW TO LESSEN OR PREVENT EXPOSSURE TO THESE HAZARDOUS CHEMICALS THROUGH USAGE OF CONTROL/WORK PRACTICES AND PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT.

STEPS THE COMPANY HAS TAKEN TO LESSEN OR PREVENT EXPOSURE TO THESE CHEMICALS.

SAFETY EMERGENCY PROCEEDURES TO FOLLOW IF THEY ARE EXPOSED TO THESE CHEMICALS.

HOW TO READ LABELS AND REWIEW MSDS's TO OBTAIN APPROPRIATE HAZARD INFORMATION.

BEFORE ANY NEW HAZARDOUS MATERIAL IS INTRODUCED INTO THE WORK-SITE AFFECTED EMPLOYEES WILL BE GIVEN SUFFICIENT INFORMATION TO ENSURE THEIR SAFETY.

5.   HAZARDOUS NON-ROUTINE TASKS

PERIODICALLY, EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRES TO PREFORM HAZARDOUS NON-ROUTINE TASKS. PRIOR TO STARTING WORK ON SUCH PROJECTS, EACH AFFECTED EMPLOYEE WILL BE GIVEN INFORMATION BY THEIR SUPERVISOR ABOUT HAZARDOUS CHEMICALS TO WHICH THEY MAY BE EXPOSOSED DURING ACTIVITY.

THIS INFORMATION WILL INCLUDE:

SPECIFIC CHEMICAL HAZARDS

PROTECTIVE/SAFETY MEASURES THE EMPLOYEE CAN TAKE

MEASURES THE COMPANY HAS TAKEN TO LESSEEN THE HAZARDS INCLUDING VENTILATION, RESPIRATORS, PRESENCE OF ANOTHER EMPLOYEE AND THE EMERGENCY PROCEDURES.

EXAMPLE OF NON-ROUTINE TASKS PREFORMED BY THIS COMPANY:

REPAIR OF NH3 NURSE TANK---ANHYDROUS AMMONIA

6.   INFORMING CONTRACTORS

IT IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE BRANCH MANAGER TO PROVIDE CONTRACTORS AND THEIR EMPLOYEES WITH THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION:

HAZARDOUS CHEMICALS TO WHICH THEY MAY

BE EXPOSED ON THE JOB SITE, AND RELATED MSDSs.

PRECAUTIONS THE EMPLOYEES MAY TAKE TO LESSEN THE POSSIBILITY OF EXPOSURE BY USING THE APPROPRIATE PROTECTIVE MEASURES (SUCH AS SOP AND PPE).

THE MAIN OFFICE WILL REQUIRE MSDSs PRIOR TO ANY CONTRACTOR BRINGING HAZARDOUS MATERIAL INTO THE PLANT. SUPERVISORS WILL BE ALERTED AND WILL PROVIDE TRAINING TO AFFECTED EMPLOYEES FORM MSDSs.

7.   LIST OF HAZARDOUS CHEMICALS

BELOW IS LISTED ALL KNOWN HAZARDOUS CHEMICALS USSED BY THIS COMPANY. FUTHER INFORMATION ON EACH HAZARDOUS CHEMICAL CAN BE OBTAINED BY REVIEWING MSDSs.
(SEE #3 ABOVE FOR LOCATION OF MSDSs)

HAZARDOUS CHEMICAL                                     WORK LOCATION

ANHYDROUS AMMONIA                                      STORAGE TANKS
NURSE TANKS 
APPLICATORS

HERBICIDES                                                       CHEMICAL STORAGE ROOM   
INSECTICIDES                                                     AT END OF BUILDING
FUNGICIDES                                                       CHEMICAL STORAGE AREA IN  
                                                                           HEATED AREA OF MAIN WAREHOUSE  

TREAT ALL CHEMICALS AS HAZARDOUS AND REPORT ANY SPILLS IMMEDIATELY TO THE MAIN OFFICE.

I.   THE FACILITY POLICY
THE MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES OF CENTRAL EIRE SUPPLY & ELEVATOR ASS'N ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA. IF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, CENTRAL ERIE IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENTS OR OTHER AUTHORIES TO MITAGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE TO PERSONS OR ENVIROMENT.

II.   FACILITY INFORMATION
THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY IS THE STORAGE AND SALE OF FERTILZERS TO THE FARMER OF THE AREA.
ANHYDOUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED, AND SOLD TO FARMERS, AS A CROP PRODUCTION NUTRIENT.
THE MAXIMUM AMOUT THAT COULD BE STORED IS 200,000 POUNDS AND THAT IS CONSIDERING BOTH A 30,000 AND A 18,000 GALLON STORAGE TANKS. THE MAXIMUM QUANITY HANDLED AT ANY ONE TIME, WOULD B

E THE UNLOADING OF A SEMI-TANKER, CONTAINING 24,000 POUNDS.

III.   WORSE-CASE RELEASE SCENARIO AND ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO
THE WORST-CASE SCENARIO WOULD BE THE RELEASE OF BOTH OUR TANKS TOTAL CONTENTS. RELEASE AS A GAS OVER A 10 MINUTE PERIOD. THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY RELEASED WOULD BE 164,000 POUNDS,WHICH REPRESENTS THE VOLUME OF THE STORAGE TANKS AT 85% CAPACITY AS LIMITED BY DESIGN STANDARDS. THE ENDPOINT FROM RELEASE WOULD BE 1.73 MILES. THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO BASED ON THE FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY IS A RELEASE FROM A BREAK IN A TRANSFER HOSE. THE DISTANCE TO THE ENDPOINT OF DISPERSONS TO 200 PPM WOULD BE .68 MILES.

IV.   ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM
THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF "SAFTY REQUIREMENTS OF THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMINIA, K-61.1", PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC. AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION, 29 CFR 1910.111, STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.

V.   FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
THERE HAS BEEN NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT CAUSED ANY DEATHS, INJURIES, OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY DAMAGE AT THE FACILITY; NOR TO OUR KNOWLEDGE, HAVE RESULTED IN OFFSITE DEATHS, INJURIES, EVACUATIONS, SHELTERING IN PLACE,PROPERTY DAMAGE, OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE.

VI.   EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
THE FACILITY HAS AN EMERENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARDS, 29 CFR 1910.38. ALSO THE FACILITY HAS PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT-TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE 111 (EPCRA).

VII.   PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFTY
SAFTY IS A ON-GOING PROCESS AT OUR PLANT. EVALUATIONS ARE MADE DAILY AND ARE ASSESSED TO MAKE SURE OF THE MAINTANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS. THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL SPECIFIC ANHYDROUS AMMONIA RECOMMENDATIONS FOR SAFETY TO BE IMPLEMENTED AT THIS TIME.
